storyInfo: Lt. Colonel Lettou, Chief Commander of the Defense Forces, arrives at the factory to preside over the changing of the flag. Feist, out on his way, and Catherine, inside the factory, bear witness to it together.

attributes.content: Several days later...
Well?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Inventory check. This lot of factories has handed in its designated amount of material.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Excellent.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Ms. Catherine, as you know, taking on Londinium's hundreds of factories and ensuring their smooth operation is by no means a simple feat.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Thus, my only option is to personally see every handover completed.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Some unpleasantness always comes part and parcel, but this handover, out of this final set of factories, has been the smoothest.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I must thank you for your willing cooperation, and for sparing me so much time.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I just don't want to do anything that'd be of no avail.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I admire your attitude, Ms. Catherine.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: But I'm afraid your heart of hearts doesn't agree with you.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: You mean...?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I hear a few days ago, some workers fled your factory. Being the case, I'd like to take stock of personnel while I'm here, and have a look at your factory's names.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: ...It was my grandson who ran.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Catherine...
attributes.name: Londinium Worker

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Young 'uns tend to do without thinking.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Very plain-dealing of you, Ms. Catherine, but frankness alone will not quell this matter.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Sir, I can't guarantee you everyone under me is of one mind. I don't have that capacity.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I can only guarantee this factory hands in its designated material quota.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Could I ascertain—are you asking me to let him go?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: He's a single tyke, every hair on his head out of place. He's hardly going to affect this factory's operation.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: But you could.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I've heard about your past deeds, Ms. Catherine.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: No wonder you were chosen as a workers' representative. A woman of honor. I esteem you for it.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: But we always must nip these things at the bud. Or are you able to guarantee me that your grandson won't become a traitor to us, such as... if he joined that Self-Salvation Corps that's all the vogue.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I've no need to guarantee it, Sir.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Young 'uns always think they can do something.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: But it always turns out they don't know what it is they're facing.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: They'll... nip themselves.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: ...I understand your sentiment.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Indeed. Pursuing a single escaped worker pales in comparison to the gravity of ensuring a dozen factories continue to stably operate.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I can overlook this affair, Ms. Catherine.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: But I do hope you're able to keep your promise.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: As long as I'm in charge of this factory, there'll never be a problem.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Excellent. In that case, it's time we get on with the handover ceremony.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: *sigh* Just our goddamned luck. I wanted to go to the factory too and watch the flag raising.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: Quit griping. You can see it from here anyway. Just tough it out.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary B

attributes.content: There's none of the gravitas here that you get watching on-site.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: Man, who the hell knew we'd actually take Victoria's capital? Dream of that in the past and you'd kick yourself.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: True enough.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary B

attributes.content: Still, next comes the hardest period. The dukes are all eyes on us.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary B

attributes.content: Hmph. If they were good for anything, we wouldn't have seized Londinium so handily.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: That was close...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Phew. Lucky these mercs have no idea the plate has a gap you can get into here.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Feist makes his way to a pipeline entrance.
He's done his survey. Somewhere along this passage is a connection to Sudean.
But now on the verge of setting foot inside it, he has doubts after all.
He wasn't kidding Patto. He's thought over every difficulty he might potentially face.
Critically, though, and what he never said, was that he didn't have a plan for every problem.
Granny wasn't wrong, after all. He's just a smith. He has a head that passes for smart, and relatively hardworking.
These two things ensured he could muddle through life fine in Londinium's peaceful years, but there's no telling if they'll save his life right under the Sarkaz's noses.
Tommy was right. If only those massive, hulking metal lads were still around.
He's all grown up, and still he's never seen a Steam Knight before.
Bang. Clang. Bang.
With the factory ceiling so high, and the hatches so small, the view of the sky can't help being miniscule from within.
Its ever-changing shades cast a like projection down into the factory. Never-changing is the sound of the assembly line, one hunk of metal striking another—
As well as the sight of old Granny, standing at its side.
Think it's dull, don't you?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Hold onto your hammer and spanner tight.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: If you really want to do something, you've got to persevere.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: You strike once, and you get nothing more than a hunk of beaten metal.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: You strike again and again, and you can make steam armor.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: You strike again and again, and then your child, and your children's children carry on striking—
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: And we've got Londinium.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: From far away comes the sound of a Sarkaz bugle, and Feist follows that sound.
Atop every factory in Londinium stands a flag.
That flag stands for Victoria.
Not once since this factory's founding has that ever changed.
But that, as of today, has changed.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Sign here, Ms. Catherine.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Without hesitation, Catherine, upon the document that embodies transferal of factory authority, signs a practiced signature.
And now, the final changing of the flag.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Go.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Yes, sir.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Stay, Ms. Catherine.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Be what it may, you are currently witnessing history.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Sir, can I light a smoke?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: By all means.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Sir, just as you've heard of me, I've heard about you too.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Gaul.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Yes... My father was a Gaulish loyalist, that's no secret.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: If you're querying me how I feel at this moment, Ms. Catherine...
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: An instant of joy that there was no blood shed throughout this procedure, but outside of that, my heart is filled with nothing but sorrow.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Not far away, Sarkaz soldiers ferry over the flag that stands for them.
Meanwhile, an additional two Sarkaz prepare to lower the current one.
Catherine can see the happiness on their faces.
And beyond them, a resplendent sunset glow.
Catherine knows. It all signifies the dark isn't long away.
Feist turns his head, and from this position, he just so happens to be able to see the factory's flagpole towering high.
He stands there, and watches as Victoria's flag descends, foot by foot.
A moment later, foot by foot, the flag of the Sarkaz rises.
As if nothing's changed at all.
He takes a deep breath, and sets foot into the pipeline.
It's pitch dark within. Apprehensively, he sets off, for the direction of Sudean he recalls.
All of Londinium's munitions factories have now completed the handover, and on this day, they have exchanged Victorian flags for those of the Sarkaz.
They flutter in the breeze.
